info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 12 at 1:16PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT STEPHENS...HABERSHAM...RABUN AND WESTERN OCONEE COUNTIES THROUGH 200 PM EDT... At 116 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 9 miles west of Clayton to 6 miles west of Clarkesville to 7 miles southeast of Cleveland. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Toccoa, Clayton, Clarkesville, Cornelia, Baldwin, Demorest, Mount Airy, Alto, Mountain City, and Tiger. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
